intro: Eryngium ekmanii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill thistle, is a flowering plant native to California, United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and spiny foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eryngium ekmanii is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
